page.title: 08RELIGION HACKFORD CHURCH.
page.content: Hackford has a fourteenth century church. The fifteenth century porch, facing south, is faced with knapped flint and flushwork panelling. Inside there is a figure of an angel in stained glass and the remains of the rood staircase.There is a fifteenth century font with eight shafts and a finely carved sixteenth century chest,with a fern design on it. The west facing tower contains one bell. The church has a plain Norman doorway, perhaps from an earlier foundation. There are no places of worship in Hackford other than that of the Church of England.
